title: Police review  hate incident  at Reginald D Hunter Edinburgh Fringe show
message:
'No crime established' after police review 'hate incident' at Reginald D Hunter Edinburgh Fringe showPolice investigating a report of a "hate incident" have said "no crime" was established after two Israeli audience members were reportedly heckled out of Reginald D Hunter's Edinburgh Fringe show.
A Police Scotland spokesperson said: "We were made aware of a hate incident, which reportedly took place at an event in Edinburgh on Sunday 11 August 2024.
In his statement posted to social media, Hunter said: "There was an unfortunate incident in my new show Fluffy Fluffy Beaver.
The Campaign Against Antisemitism charity said the "events described at the Edinburgh Fringe are extremely concerning".
Hunter and the Edinburgh venue have been contacted for additional comment.

title: In speech about antisemitism , Trump blames Harris and focuses on anti - Israel forces
message:
In a speech about antisemitism, Donald Trump said Jews are facing a climate akin to the run-up to the Holocaust due to the actions of anti-Israel forces — and placed the blame squarely on his opponent while omitting any mention of antisemitism from the far right.
He also repeated his claim that Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack on Israel wouldn’t have happened had he been president.
“By re-affirming our support for President Trump, Jewish voices across the country are working to deliver President Trump a second term and put a stop to radical antisemitism.”Among the endorsers were Trump’s former ambassador to Israel, David Friedman.
“I really don’t call her Harris because nobody knows who Harris is,” he said.
Trump also praised Hungarian leader Viktor Orban, who has drawn accusations of antisemitism from Hungarian Jews, as “a very strong person.”

On Tuesday, October 13, 2020, in Sarcelles, a suburb of Paris, France, Antisemitic graffiti was discovered on 37 Jewish gravestones. The political establishment condemned the vandalism. title: Trump Vows to Deport Hamas Supporters During  Stop Antisemitism  Event , Unveils New Initiative for Jewish Voters
message:
Former US President Donald Trump vowed to deport foreign supporters of the Palestinian terrorist group Hamas if he’s re-elected to the White House during an event centered on anti-Jewish hate on Thursday.
In an attempt to lure more Jewish voters, Trump’s campaign announced the launch of “Jewish Voices for Trump” this week.
With President Trump we knew we had a White House that stood with Israel, and a president who defended the Jewish people,” the group’s mission statement read.
Recent polling indicates that Jewish voters may be shifting to Trump in record-breaking numbers, suggesting that the former president’s overtures could be working.
Jewish voters prefer Harris over Trump by a margin of 52.7 percent to 45.9 percent, according to the survey conducted by pollster Richard Baris.
